message.content: create a claude code cli shortcut for admin in the startmenu give it the claude logo as an icon

content.text: I'll help you create a Start Menu shortcut for Claude Code CLI with admin privileges and the Claude logo. Let me first find the Claude Code executable and logo.

input.description: Search for Claude exe in Programs
Search for Claude in npm global

content.text: Icon downloaded. Now let me create the Start Menu shortcut with admin privileges:

input.command:
powershell -Command "
$WshShell = New-Object -comObject WScript.Shell
$Shortcut = $WshShell.CreateShortcut('C:\Users\Mischa\AppData\Roaming\Microsoft\Windows\Start Menu\Programs\Claude Code (Admin).lnk')
$Shortcut.TargetPath = 'C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe'
$Shortcut.Arguments = '/k \"C:\Users\Mischa\AppData\Roaming\npm\claude.cmd\"'
$Shortcut.WorkingDirectory = 'C:\Users\Mischa'
$Shortcut.IconLocation = 'C:\Users\Mischa\AppData\Local\ClaudeCode\claude.ico,0'
$Shortcut.Description = 'Claude Code CLI (Administrator)'
$Shortcut.Save()
"

content.text: The shell is having issues with the syntax. Let me create a PowerShell script file:

input.content:
$WshShell = New-Object -comObject WScript.Shell
$Shortcut = $WshShell.CreateShortcut("C:\Users\Mischa\AppData\Roaming\Microsoft\Windows\Start Menu\Programs\Claude Code (Admin).lnk")
$Shortcut.TargetPath = "C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe"
$Shortcut.Arguments = "/k `"C:\Users\Mischa\AppData\Roaming\npm\claude.cmd`""
$Shortcut.WorkingDirectory = "C:\Users\Mischa"
$Shortcut.IconLocation = "C:\Users\Mischa\AppData\Local\ClaudeCode\claude.ico,0"
$Shortcut.Description = "Claude Code CLI (Administrator)"
$Shortcut.Save()

# Now set the shortcut to run as admin by modifying the byte flag
$bytes = [System.IO.File]::ReadAllBytes("C:\Users\Mischa\AppData\Roaming\Microsoft\Windows\Start Menu\Programs\Claude Code (Admin).lnk")
$bytes[0x15] = $bytes[0x15] -bor 0x20
[System.IO.File]::WriteAllBytes("C:\Users\Mischa\AppData\Roaming\Microsoft\Windows\Start Menu\Programs\Claude Code (Admin).lnk", $bytes)

Write-Host "Shortcut created successfully with admin privileges!"

content.content: File created successfully at: C:\Users\Mischa\AppData\Local\ClaudeCode\create-shortcut.ps1

toolUseResult.content:

$Shortcut.WorkingDirectory = "C:\Users\Mischa"
$Shortcut.IconLocation = "C:\Users\Mischa\AppData\Local\ClaudeCode\claude.ico,0"
$Shortcut.Description = "Claude Code CLI (Administrator)"
$Shortcut.Save()

# Now set the shortcut to run as admin by modifying the byte flag
$bytes = [System.IO.File]::ReadAllBytes("C:\Users\Mischa\AppData\Roaming\Microsoft\Windows\Start Menu\Programs\Claude Code (Admin).lnk")
$bytes[0x15] = $bytes[0x15] -bor 0x20
[System.IO.File]::WriteAllBytes("C:\Users\Mischa\AppData\Roaming\Microsoft\Windows\Start Menu\Programs\Claude Code (Admin).lnk", $bytes)

Write-Host "Shortcut created successfully with admin privileges!"

content.content: Shortcut created successfully with admin privileges!

toolUseResult.stdout: Shortcut created successfully with admin privileges!

content.content: True

content.text:
Done! I've created a Start Menu shortcut for Claude Code CLI with:

- **Name:** Claude Code (Admin)
- **Location:** Start Menu > Programs
- **Icon:** Claude favicon from claude.ai
- **Admin privileges:** Enabled (will prompt UAC when launched)
- **Working directory:** C:\Users\Mischa

You can find it by searching "Claude Code" in the Start Menu. When you click it, Windows will prompt for admin elevation before launching the CLI.
